CatDescriptText: Miss Kathy Rider, student, Squirrel Hill and Miss Sandi Sims, student, Squirrel Hill, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1962, pg. 6 with question: "Do you think Southerners are sincere in wanting to send Negroes without jobs to the North on Freedom Trains?" Mrs. Kathy Rider's answer reads: "...Just shipping the people North without jobs is wrong..."  Miss Sandi Sims answer reads: "The are wrong in sending the people North, because everyone should have the rights to live and to work where they please."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Group portrait of Kathy Rider, and Sandi Sims, wearing floral dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of man wearing eyeglasses, dark suit with flag or rectangular pin in lapel, and dark tie, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
